column6: a Jewish American housewife who discovers her flair for stand-up comedy after her husband leaves her. She finds a job as a make-up counter girl at B. Altman and starts performing stand-up comedy in clubs across New York.
an employee of The Gaslight Cafe and Midge's manager.

Midge's estranged husband, who leaves Midge for his secretary. He is an aspiring, though untalented, stand-up comic who copies Bob Newhart's routines. Joel quits his uncle's plastics company and ends up working at his father's garment factory. Lenny Palmieri portrays a thirteen-year-old Joel in a guest appearance in the episode "Put That On Your Plate!".
Midge's mother who later becomes a matchmaker.
Midge's father, a mathematics professor at Columbia University and researcher at Bell Labs. He later begins a new career as the theater critic for The Village Voice.
Joel's father, the owner of Maisel and Roth Garment Company.
Joel's mother.

a successful stand-up comic who uses a fat suit and schtick gimmicks to portray a frumpy, uncouth housewife from Queens in her act. In reality, she is a rich, snobbish Manhattan socialite with refined tastes.
a well-known New York City comedian and close friend of Midge's.
the Weissmans' maid.
Midge and Joel's elder child.
the emcee at The Gaslight. After Tarantina's death, his character dies offscreen of a stroke in season 4.
Imogene's husband and Joel's coworker.
Midge's best friend.
Joel's secretary, former childhood nanny, and Penny's replacement.
Joel's former secretary and girlfriend.
Midge's brother. He is secretly an analyst for the CIA.
the floor supervisor at B. Altman.
Noah's wife and Midge's sister-in-law. She is very insecure about the fact that she was not born Jewish.
a successful manager of comedians with clients including Sophie Lennon.
Abe's boss at Bell Labs.
Midge's lawyer and a former activist acquaintance of Abe's.
Sophie Lennon’s acerbic butler
a doctor whom Midge meets in the Catskills and later begins to date.
a low-level mob enforcer partnered with Nicky and later develops a friendship with Susie
a low-level mob enforcer partnered with Frank and later develops a friendship with Susie
a singer who gives Midge her big break to be his opening act on tour.
Susie's sister.
a coworker of Midge's at B. Altman who works at the switchboard.
an agent that Susie networks with for booking gigs with Midge.
a stalker of Susie who later becomes her roommate.
a worker at Maisel & Roth.
Shy Baldwin's manager.
a mysterious Chinese-American woman who has connections to an illegal gambling ring underneath Joel's new club.
a bass player in Baldwin's orchestra who becomes a friendly mentor to Midge; she is very loosely modeled on renowned bassist Carol Kaye, though Kaye found the character an insulting representation.
Sophie Lennon's co-star in Miss Julie.
Abe's old friend who is a playwright.
a burlesque dancer at The Wolford
a talk show host
a magician who Susie manages
the stage manager at a Manhattan burlesque club called The Wolford
Susie’s receptionist
a newspaper critic reviewing Midge’s acts
a booker on the Gordon Ford Show
a leader of a matchmaking consortium based in NYC
a NYC matchmaker
a NYC matchmaker
a NYC matchmaker
